com.gej.graphics

Class GFont

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gej.graphics.GFont

  • public class GFont
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a game font made from a single sprite sheet. Uses Images to represent alphabets. You can use the GFontAdvanced class to load the fonts from the font descriptors like this. 
     GFont font = GFontAdvanced.getFont(Game.loadImage("<path-to-image>"), "<path-to-descriptor>");
    Author:
    Sri Harsha Chilakapati

    • Method Detail

      • renderText

        public void renderText(java.lang.String txt,
              java.awt.Graphics2D g,
              int x,
              int y)
        This is the method which we use to draw text on the window. Note that the maximum length of the string is 40 cols.
        Parameters:
        txt - - The text to be drawn
        g - - The Graphics2D object
        x - - The starting x position
        y - - The starting y position
